name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, v. Appellant, Albert William KEPPEL, Jr., Appellee

judges: BEFORE: CAPPY, C.J., and CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN, SAYLOR and BAER, JJ.
Justice EAKIN did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, v. Appellant, Albert William KEPPEL, Jr., Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 21st day of June, 2004, the order of the Lancaster County Court of Common Pleas is reversed insofar as it declared the Registration of Sexual Offenders Act unconstitutional, and the case is remanded for further proceedings. See Commonwealth v. Williams, 574 Pa. 487, 832 A.2d 962 (2003); Commonwealth v. Maldonado, 576 Pa. 101, 838 A.2d 710 (2003).
Justice EAKIN did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Kelly M. Sekula, Esq., for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Lyn R. Bailey, Esq., James Jude Karl, Esq., Lancaster, for Albert William Keppel, Jr.
casebody.head_matter:
851 A.2d 857
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, v. Appellant, Albert William KEPPEL, Jr., Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Nov. 10, 2003.
Decided June 21, 2004.
Kelly M. Sekula, Esq., for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Lyn R. Bailey, Esq., James Jude Karl, Esq., Lancaster, for Albert William Keppel, Jr.
BEFORE: CAPPY, C.J., and CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN, SAYLOR and BAER, JJ.
